title: Waistcoat, 1765–75
medium:
Medium: silk, metal
Technique: embroidered with metal-wrapped silk, sequins (pailletes) and coils of wire of two types; on a foundation of plain weave silk with continuous supplementary weft of metal-wrapped silk
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Gentleman's waistcoat in off-white silk with metallic, embroidered lightly on the front and lower edges and pocket area with gold thread, colored metallic sequins and coils of wire.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat, 1765–75.
1765–75. Medium: silk, metal
Technique: embroidered with metal-wrapped silk, sequins (pailletes) and coils of wire of two types; on a foundation of plain weave silk with continuous supplementary weft of metal-wrapped silk. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-54-8.
